content.formatted_body: annevk: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/67730604/should-a-304-not-modified-response-to-a-cors-request-contain-cors-headers

content.body:
I see the non-normative note at https://fetch.spec.whatwg.org/#ref-for-concept-cors-check%E2%91%A0, which says:
> As the CORS check is not to be applied to responses whose status is 304 or 407, or responses from a service worker for that matter, it is applied here.
content.formatted_body:
I see the non-normative note at https://fetch.spec.whatwg.org/#ref-for-concept-cors-check%E2%91%A0, which says:

As the CORS check is not to be applied to responses whose status is 304 or 407, or responses from a service worker for that matter, it is applied here.

content.body: ‚Ä¶but I can‚Äôt find which normative part of the spec has a requirement that requires the CORS check to not be performed for `304`s
content.formatted_body: ‚Ä¶but I can‚Äôt find which normative part of the spec has a requirement that requires the CORS check to not be performed for 304s
